statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ -3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 2 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 6 \\ -10 \\ 4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -3 \\ 2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -1 \\ -3 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 2 \\ 0 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 6 \\ -10 \\ 4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -2 \\ -4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
